history.content:
If you plan to declare CS, you shouldn't be taking Math 54 unless needed by another major. EE16A and EE16B are much more relevant and insightful than math 54. Beyond this, from personal experience, the TAs and professors tend to be more supportive and care more about the students than those from math 54. That being said, CS70 is a pretty fundamental class so I would take CS70 first.

I would personally recommend focusing on CS70 and CS61A and not taking any other heavy classes just to get the most out of them as they are so important to do well in and lay the foundational understanding of CS but that should be taken with a grain of salt as I know some who would still excel with four technicals. If you have spent any significant time on previous technicals or did not do exceedingly well in them, I would not reccommend such a heavy schedule.

children.subject: Its not the professor always, its sometimes the material that is covered in the class that is more important. EE16A covers concepts that are more conducive to a complete CS education and therefore, you should strongly be considering that class. Just saying..
Thanks for your response. I was initially planning to take EE16A, but then I noticed the Math 54 professor next semester is apparently rly good.

history.content:
Any thoughts on taking Math 54, CS 70, CS61A, and Stat88 together? I am a sophomore, and I will not have any other time commitments next semester - will focus mainly on academics. Thanks!

should I swap CS 70 with EE16A?
